content: tunisian poncho sweater asymmetric tunisian poncho sweater ripple this pattern is for a poncho in tunisian gauge crochet or add sleeves for the complete 10 st x 8 row = ±10 cm x 10 cm 4 x4 sweater it contains a picture tutorial for the before starting this item you need to check stitches and a written description your gauge by making a test piece this is material important to get the right measurements of  yarn your sweater make a test piece in the julia 170 m/ 186 yrd 100 gr/ 3 53 tunisian stitch of the pattern see instructions ounces from zeeman or other bulky tunisian stitch due to the weight and the yarn 7 wpi with which you can obtain type of stitch the fabric will stretch gauge i used 2 colors green 2 skeins stitch abbreviations and mint green 2 skeins tks tunisian knit stitch 1 skein of fluffy mint green 100gr/ half_double_crochet half_double_crochet 110 m form zeeman fphdc front post half_double_crochet  tunisian hook size 10mm with a 80 cm bphdc back post half_double_crochet connecting thread fp forward pass rp reverse pass  crochet hook size 7 mm for the chain chain st stitch es sleeves slip_stitch slip_stitch yo yarn over  yarn needle measurements  scissors the poncho sweater can be made in 1 size s- l at the end of this pattern i also give tips for bigger sizes xl-xxxl a= arm opening b= neck opening c= side seam d= arm seam e= bottom f= side seam 1 tunisian poncho sweater body the scheme on this page shows the colors for every row in green mint green and grey= fluffly it shows 10 st however each row contains 67 st in total there are 112 row 2 times 56 start with row 1 in the color scheme foundation row row 1 scheme chain 67 the chain has a front and back at the front you see the v s of the loops 1 turn the chain to the back you now see the horizontal bumps on top of the chain 2 fp insert your hook on the back side of the chain in the 2nd horizontal bump from the hook yo and pull up a loop repeat this for all the other bumps you now got 67 loops on your hook 3 if you find this difficult you can also just make the fp in de front of the loops start in the 2nd chain from your hook i prefer the first option this way the v s of the loops will be nicely under the stitches and the end will not curl too much rp chain 1 4 yo and pull the yarn through the first two loops on your hook these two loops are now crocheted together 5 yo and pull the yarn through the next two loops on your hook repeat this until you have 1 loop on your hook 6 this is the first loop of your next row
